skill.name: code-review
skill.description: Complete code review workflow for both requesting and receiving reviews. Use when creating PRs, reviewing code, or responding to feedback.

skill.author: Doyajin174

security_audit.summary: Pure markdown documentation skill containing only PR templates, checklists, and response patterns. No executable code, file access, network calls, or command execution. All static findings are false positives from pattern matching without semantic understanding.

content.user_title: Review code and manage PR feedback
content.value_statement: This skill streamlines the code review process from both perspectives. It provides templates for creating effective PRs and guidelines for responding to reviewer feedback constructively.
actual_capabilities: Generate comprehensive PR descriptions using templates
Create pre-submission checklists for code reviews
Formulate constructive responses to reviewer feedback
Apply team code review best practices
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests
Does not access external code repositories directly
Does not integrate with CI/CD systems
Does not perform automated code analysis

use_cases.title: Create Effective PRs
use_cases.description: Prepare pull requests with clear context, testing confirmation, and structured descriptions for reviewers.

use_cases.title: Give Quality Feedback
use_cases.description: Provide constructive, prioritized feedback with clear must/should/could classifications and positive recognition.

use_cases.title: Standardize Review Process
use_cases.description: Establish consistent code review patterns across team members with shared templates and guidelines.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Review Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code change. The PR description follows this template: What: [one-line summary], Why: [reason for change], How: [implementation approach], Testing: [test status]. Focus on bugs, edge cases, and clarity.

prompt_templates.title: Feedback Response
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me respond to this reviewer feedback. The feedback type is [bug/style/design/opinion]. My original intent was [explanation]. Draft a response that is [accepting/explanatory/discussing].

prompt_templates.title: Self Review Checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Walk through this self-review checklist for my PR: tests pass, no lint errors, changes are focused, commit messages follow conventions, and context is clear. Point out any gaps.

prompt_templates.title: Constructive Feedback
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this PR code. Structure feedback by priority: Must-fix (blocking issues), Should-fix (important problems), Could-fix (improvements). Include at least one positive observation.

output_examples.input: Review this authentication fix and help me respond to the feedback about adding rate limiting
output: Suggested response: Good catch on rate limiting. I have added basic protection in commit abc123. For production, we should add token bucket limiting - would you prefer I add that now or file a follow-up ticket?

output_examples.input: Help me write a PR description for a new database migration
output: What: Add user email verification column to users table
Why: Required for upcoming email verification feature launch
How: Added nullable email_verified_at column with migration file
Testing: Migration tested locally, unit tests added for new column access

output_examples.input: Give feedback on this security-related PR
output: Must-fix: Input validation is missing for user_id parameter - could lead to injection
Should-fix: Error messages reveal internal implementation details
Could-fix: Variable naming could be more descriptive for auth flows
Positive: Good test coverage on the authentication logic

best_practices: Keep PRs small (under 300 lines) for faster reviews
Provide context about what changed and why
Self-review before requesting feedback from others
Separate blocking issues from suggestions using priority labels
anti_patterns: Submitting large PRs without clear scope or context
Defensive or dismissive responses to reviewer feedback
Skipping self-review and relying only on automated checks
Ignoring style feedback without consulting team conventions

faq.question: What tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works in any Claude CLI session.

faq.question: What size PRs should I submit?
faq.answer: Keep changes under 300 lines when possible. Larger changes should be split into logical chunks.

faq.question: Can this integrate with GitHub or GitLab?
faq.answer: This skill provides templates and guidelines. Actual integration requires platform-specific tools.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only processes text locally. No code is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if I disagree with reviewer feedback?
faq.answer: Use the structured response patterns to explain your reasoning. Request a discussion if needed.

faq.question: How is this different from automated linting?
faq.answer: Automated tools catch syntax and style issues. This skill helps with human communication, context, and judgment.
